Package fr.rphstudio.chess.launcher

Class MainLauncher

java.lang.Object
org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame
fr.rphstudio.chess.launcher.MainLauncher
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.newdawn.slick.ControlledInputReciever, org.newdawn.slick.ControllerListener, org.newdawn.slick.Game, org.newdawn.slick.InputListener, org.newdawn.slick.KeyListener, org.newdawn.slick.MouseListener
public class MainLauncher
extends org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame
This is the main class for this Object-Oriented Programming course. This application uses the Slick2D Java Library for the user interface. /!\ DO NOT MODIFY THIS CLASS /!\

  • Method Details

    • fitScreen

      public static void fitScreen​(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer container, org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
      This method will resize the graphic work area to fit in the computer screen. The HD ratio is maintained. If the computer screen has not the same ratio, the displayed area is centered.
      Parameters:
      container - the game container containing a lot of system information.
      g - the graphical object used to access the graphic work area.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
      Main method for this class. This is the entry point of our application.
      Parameters:
      args - parameters of applications.
      Throws:
      org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - Exception from the Slick2D library.

    • initStatesList

      public void initStatesList​(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer container) throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
      Method called at start. It is used to register all the game execution controllers. We have only one here, the 'ChessGameController'.
      Specified by:
      initStatesList in class org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame
      Parameters:
      container - the game container containing a lot of system information.
      Throws:
      org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - Exception from the Slick2D library.
